scenarioDescription:
The HD 37124 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 37124 is a star with 0.85 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 103.27 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 4 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 37124 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 37124 system


HD 37124 b

HD 37124 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory, in 2003-01, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.53 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 37124 b is 214.650 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 37124 b is 14.000 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 37124 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


HD 37124 c

HD 37124 c was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory, in 2003-01, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.71 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 37124 c is 207.336 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 37124 c is 14.100 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 37124 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


HD 37124 d

HD 37124 d was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory, in 2005-10, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.81 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 37124 d is 221.328 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 37124 d is 14.000 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 37124 d is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HD 37124, which contains 3 exoplanets and was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory.
name: HD 37124 - System With 3 Exoplanets
